channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Live Briefing: Top Hezbollah spokesman killed; Israeli attack kills 70 in north Gaza, official says
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Jennifer Hassan, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: Mohammad Afif was killed in an Israeli airstrike on Ras al-Nabaa, a heavily populated part of central Beirut, Hezbollah-aligned media said.

item.title: Israeli airstrike on central Beirut kills senior Hezbollah official
item.dc:creator: Suzan Haidamous, Rebecca Tan

item.title: Israel to issue conscription notices to ultra-Orthodox community
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Lior Soroka

item.title: At least 70 killed in Israeli airstrike in Beit Lahia, official says
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Jennifer Hassan, Miriam Berger, Hazem Balousha

item.title: Iran hawks will hold less sway in Trump’s new government
item.dc:creator: Abigail Hauslohner
item.description: Republicans are split over how aggressive the next Trump administration should be toward Tehran as the president-elect pursues an America-first foreign policy.

item.title: Russia launches more than 200 missiles and drones at Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady
item.description: The attack damaged energy infrastructure and killed at least two people just ahead of the 1,000-day mark since Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: The struggle against climate change is floundering. Enter Trump.
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Even before Donald Trump’s election, global climate action faced challenges.

item.title: Lebanon reviews cease-fire proposal as Israel launches fresh strikes
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman, Victoria Bisset, Abbie Cheeseman, Sammy Westfall
item.description: Fresh Israeli strikes hit Beirut’s southern suburbs Saturday. Lebanon is expected to respond to a U.S.-backed ceasefire proposal soon.

item.title: Iran’s defense minister arrives in Damascus to meet Syrian officials
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall, Susannah George, Abbie Cheeseman, Sammy Westfall, Suzan Haidamous

item.title: Venezuela releases 70 political prisoners from post-election sweep
item.dc:creator: Samantha Schmidt
item.description: It was the first major release of dissidents since the start of President Nicolás Maduro’s crackdown, which advocates say has been the worst in the country’s recent history.

item.title: IDF continues attacks on southern Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall

item.title: South Africa denies illegal miners food and water to force them out
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall
item.description: Officials are blocking access to basic supplies for hundreds of people underground in a northwest mine shaft as part of a crackdown on miners.

item.title: How a U.S. drug arrest made Mexico more violent
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan
item.description: The capture of Ismael “El Mayo” Zambada has ignited an all-out battle for control of the Sinaloa cartel, one of the world’s most famous drug gangs.

item.title: Pentagon urged to make payments for slain, injured civilians
item.dc:creator: Meg Kelly, Missy Ryan
item.description: Groups have appealed to Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin to address a backlog of civilian casualty claims before the Biden administration leaves office.

item.title: Gaza strikes kill at least 26, civil defense says
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Hajar Harb

item.title: Israel drops massive bomb in Beirut strike, as Lebanon mulls cease-fire
item.dc:creator: Abbie Cheeseman, Suzan Haidamous

item.title: Trump denigrates Haitians. How will his election affect Haiti?
item.dc:creator: Amanda Coletta
item.description: A key decision awaiting the president-elect is whether to continue supporting a U.S.-funded, U.N.-backed, Kenya-led policing mission.

item.title: Russia wants Kursk back before negotiations. Ukraine isn’t budging.
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Serhii Korolchuk, Francesca Ebel, Sarah Cahlan
item.description: Ukrainian troops are facing down a ferocious Russian counteroffensive in Kursk as Putin seeks to take back Russian land before any talks.

item.title: Philippines pivots from battling militants to projecting power at sea
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan
item.description: Philippine leaders say they can turn their attention to the South China Sea because they’ve secured peace with separatist rebels. But the situation remains precarious.

item.title: Man caught trying to smuggle hundreds of tarantulas on a plane
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong
item.description: In addition to the spiders, the South Korean traveler also had 110 centipedes and nine bullet ants in containers taped to his body, Peruvian authorities said.

item.title: Global health experts sound alarm over RFK Jr., citing Samoa outbreak
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall, Lena H. Sun
item.description: Experts and officials said a 2019 measles outbreak in Samoa, which came after a visit by Kennedy, exemplified the dangers of his rhetoric.

item.title: Israel drops massive bomb in Beirut strike, as Lebanon mulls cease-fire
item.dc:creator: Abbie Cheeseman, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: Israel has stepped up strikes on the city’s southern suburbs in recent days, an area Israeli officials say hosts Hezbollah militants and infrastructure.

item.title: A baby red panda choked to death. Her vets blame fireworks.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Edwards
item.description: Officials at the Edinburgh Zoo want lawmakers to ban pyrotechnics after concluding that they caused 3-month-old Roxie’s stress-induced vomiting.

item.title: North Korea’s Kim Jong Un has never been more brazen — or in demand
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee
item.description: Donald Trump says the North Korean leader ‘misses him.’ But Kim Jong Un has a new ally now in Russia’s Vladimir Putin, and that’s emboldening him like never before.

item.title: Trump taps Rubio for secretary of state. What are his foreign policy views?
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands, Karen DeYoung
item.description: Donald Trump said Sen. Marco Rubio of Florida will be secretary of state. Here’s where Rubio stands on the Israel-Gaza and Russia-Ukraine wars, NATO and more.

item.title: Gaza strikes kill at least 26, civil defense says
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Hajar Harb

item.title: IDF sends enlistment notices to ultra-Orthodox Jews
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman, Loveday Morris, Andrew Jeong, Alon Rom, Sammy Westfall
item.description: Defense Minister Israel Katz gave the go-ahead for 7,000 draft notices to be sent to ultra-Orthodox Jews for enlistment in the Israel Defense Forces.
